stories.title: 20 Years of Product Management in 25 Minutes by Dave Wascha

stories.text:
Hi all! We’re considering a move to AWS from an on-premise Kubernetes installation. For someone who hasn’t played much with AWS before, how would you recommend to most efficiently get up to speed with best practices, architecture patterns, common pitfalls, etc.?

Ideally, we would not lift-and-shift our applications, but instead rearchitect important parts to actually take advantage of AWS’ benefits.

So - any great resources you can recommend? Courses, books, blog posts - any recommendations would be appreciated.

Thanks!
stories.title: Ask HN: Best way to ramp up my AWS-fu from scratch in 2021
Schmidt and Kissinger: The Challenge of Being Human in the Age of AI

stories.text:
We’ve just launched NUM [1] in the UK, it’s an alternative to the semantic web [2] but based in DNS. We’ve published 23 million data points about 4.8m UK businesses.

We had some really interesting HN feedback when we previously posted about one of our example apps [3] so keen to hear what the community has to say this time round.

1. https://www.num.uk

2. https://num.uk/blog/we-crawled-5m-uk-websites-and-published-23m-data-points-to-dns

3. https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=27598164
stories.title: Show HN: DNS-based alternative to Semantic Web – 23M data points now in DNS
